page.title: 11LANGLEYBURY
page.content: Beyond Sarratt village there are no other significant settlements.The area is largely agricultural or woodland. To the east of the area lies Langley- bury School and Home Farm.Whippendell Wood is a popular spot for local people.Extensive changes to the farmscape have occurred recently due to the building of the M25.Certain roads have been re-routed and large- scale excavations have been necessary. It is an area of grassland and arable crops,with scattered woods.Clays and gravels,used by the quarrymen,overlie chalk,and the gently rolling landscape is cut by several dry valleys adding to the area's appeal for visitors. Visitors are attracted to the district to walk along its numerous well-marked footpaths,to enjoy the views or to sample one of the several country pubs.
